content: Financial Aid Financial Aid Basics Types of Aid Receive Aid Maintain Eligibility Manage Costs Repay Loans Resources for...ParentsNew/Incoming StudentsCurrent StudentsDeparting Students Parents New/Incoming Students Current Students Departing Students Forms Contact Us Apply Online Request Info Visit Campus DePaul University>Admission & Aid>Financial Aid>Resources for...>Current Students Resources for Current Students You've done the hard part. You've applied, been accepted, enrolled and received aid — now what? We've got you covered. The Office of Financial Aid can help you through your entire journey at DePaul.Contact us. Receive Aid— Congrats on receiving aid! Here's what you need to do to make sure your account reflects your award. Maintain Eligibility— Certain academic progress requirements apply to financial aid recipients. Learn how to keep the aid you've worked so hard for. Appeal Suspension— If your financial aid has been suspended because you failed to meet minimum academic requirements, you can submit an appeal. Manage Costs— Sticking to a budget is important. Learn about DePaul's payment plan options and budgeting resources. Financial Aid TV— Watch short videos covering everything from FAFSA changes and loan exit counseling to education tax benefits and identity theft. Forms— Whether you're looking for a loan form or need to submit an appeal, we have all the forms you could possibly need — all in one place. Repay Loans— It's never too early to start planning loan repayment. Contact Us— We're always here to help. Give us a call, send us an email or stop by the office. Leaving DePaul or graduating soon? See ourResources for Departing Students.
